basic_info.description: I'm Thomas Selden, a recent graduate of NJIT's Full Stack BootCamp, where we learned about both Front-End(html, css, bootstrap, javascript, and react) and Back-End(sql, mongoDB, and python) technologies. Currently, I plan on continuing my education on my own and want to start learning C#!

projects.title: ChatLy
projects.description: MERN Stack Messaging App: This was my first project I've worked on with a team! It was a great learning experience, with working out conflict issues in the repo, to reviewing fellow team members code, I learned a great deal of what it means to be apart of a programming team! My main role on the application was setting up user authentication and minor tweaks to other parts of the code. The following link is to the git repository and in the description there's a link to where it's hosted.

projects.title: Reddit Clone
projects.description: Reddit Clone: This is a reddit clone I've been working on in my free time. There is still a lot of functionality I'd like to add, but so far I'm proud of what I've accomplished. This project helped me learn more about NextJS and a really cool technology called StepZen, which makes it easier to work with GraphQL. All in all, I've learned a lot about querying and mutating a database, which was exactly what I was trying to do! Also this was my first project using mostly Typescript!

projects.title: 3D Object Viewer
projects.description: One of the first apps I was working on my internship. I had to develop front-end implementation for app that shows 3D models of known buildings. This was also my first project in Angular framework. I've learned a lot!
